title: Naples police have suspect in fatal shooting
content:
NAPLES, TX (KLTV) -
Naples police say they have a suspect in a shooting that injured one person and left another dead.
The police department has not identified the person or disclosed if they are in custody.
Police say that about 7:08 p.m. Saturday, officers responded to a shooting in the city at an undisclosed location.
"Once officers arrived on scene they found one deceased male and one female victim who sustained injuries from gunshot wounds," the police department said in a statement.
The woman was transported to a hospital for treatment.
In a Facebook post, Paul Pewitt High School administrators identified the person who died as sophomore Deadrian Webster. The school says first responders were unable to revive Webster.
Paul Pewitt High School held a candlelight vigil Sunday at the school's football stadium in memory of Webster. Counselors and ministers are expected to be available to students or faculty throughout the day.
"The Texas Rangers are assisting in the investigation and do have a suspect. We want to reinforce that this was not a gang-related offense nor was it a drive-by shooting. Please keep the family and friends of this young man in your prayers as this has been a tragic event in our small town," NPD said.
